title: Drawing, Two capitals of columns, with alternative suggestions, 1780–1800
title_raw: Two capitals of columns, with alternative suggestions
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray watercolor, graphite on off-white laid paper
markings: watermark: escutcheon, probably with G B
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: acquired by Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: At left: with a swan, at right: with a volute and a cherub; at right, with the half figure of a fantastic fish. In the center a head with a festoon at left, a palm branch at right. rinceaux, at left with a panel. Broken columns below.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Two capitals of columns, with alternative suggestions, 1780–1800. Pen and black ink, brush and gray watercolor, graphite on off-white laid paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4616.
